This game reminded me that video games can be fun. Fun and yet incredibly rewarding and satisfying. I'm a huge fan of the fact that you can earn anything you see in game. Premium currency? You can find it on the planets or earn it through the war bonds. You don't have to resort to pulling out your wallet for all the cool stuff. And that's another thing this game gets absolutely right - it makes you feel cool. Throwing a targeting beacon for a mini-nuke and diving away from the explosion while spreading liberty will forever be a memory for my friends and I now.
I just hope people bother to learn the ins and outs of the game and it's multitude of death dealing stratagems.

The game is an absolute blast with strangers and/or buddies. The combat is fun, the controls are very responsive and the visuals are amazing; that is, of course, if you can even log in to play. Since launch the game has been riddled with a myriad of server and connections issues. From not being able to match-make, not being able to play with friends, not being able to log in, and the most recent, the death of democracy to a black screen as soon as you launch the game.

These issues will likely be fixed within a month but it's not a good look. A lot of people are hyped to play the game only to be greeted with a black screen and non-stop server issues.

Currently I cannot recommend the game. I'd give it time for the devs to figure out the server capacity issues and whatnot.

Edit: Now that the servers are no longer on fire, the game seems to be performing admirably and can now recommend the game.

[h3]This game is deserving of the Game of the Year title![/h3]
HELLDIVERS 2 does an even better job compared to its predecessor at making you feel like you are part in an actual galactic war on two different fronts.

The atmosphere starts as soon as you launch the game and you will be dragged right into the fight for Super Earth.

Arrowhead keeps the whole community up to date on their Discord with a High Command Dispatch Channel and the newest major orders that everyone can follow for more rewards, what planets have been liberated or have fallen and what stratagem is sometimes available by the gamemaster. 

They also have been pushing updates out almost daily now, fixing the server issues and increased the player cap, while also squishing a lot of them bugs (pun intended).

The gunplay feels great. All the weapons feel punchy, sound amazing and shooting off different body parts and the armor of the different enemy types feels perfect. 
HELLDIVERS 2 also looks stunning, explosions look cinematic as hell.

Fighting the Termites feels completely different compared to fighting the Automatons too. The first one feels like you are playing Starship Troopers with your friends, while the second faction feels like fighting against robots from the movie Terminator.

With how active Arrowhead is, how passionate they appear to be and how this game has huge potential to keep expanding as the galactic map has at least a hundred different planets that will probably become available to play on at some point, HELLDIVERS 2 has to be one if not the best game to come out in the last two years.

Speaking of huge potential, the first game actually had three factions. So I would not be surprised if the Illuminites show up at the bottom of the galactic map or if they would even add a fourth factions to fight against at the top.

All in all, I highly recommend everyone who is even remotely into shooters to check this game out or try it for less than 2 hours to then refund it, if they do not like it.

[b]HELLDIVERS 2 is just an amazing game that no one should miss![/b]

On my 3060ti running at medium graphics causes overheating which makes me encounter massive FPS drops and stuttering that make the game unplayable. I'm often at 7 fps with 300ms of render latency. That's after waiting 5 minutes to an hour to be able to log in.

The game is fun when playable, although I'm not a fan of the pay to win DLC that is objectively better than the free route. But so much time is lost logging in and there are so many performance issues that I can only cautiously recommend this to people who want to play with a friend group.

Helldivers 2 is, a virtual realm where comrades unite to fight for freedom and justice! The gameplay, much like the delicate dance of the Bar-ba-loots in the Truffula forest, is a synchronized symphony of strategy and cooperation. The cooperative multiplayer aspect is a true testament to the power of teamwork, a lesson we can all learn from nature.

The graphics, reminiscent of the vibrant colors of a Tufted Mazurka flower, are a feast for the eyes. The lush environments and intricate details transport players to a world where the stakes are high, much like the precious balance of ecosystems in our own reality.

Now, the weapons! Just as I guard the last Truffula seed with determination, Helldivers 2 provides an arsenal that ignites the spirit of justice. The variety of weapons feels as diverse as the flora and fauna in the Once-ler's untouched Thneedville.

And let us not forget the overarching theme of freedom, echoing the Lorax's plea to speak for the trees. Helldivers 2 embodies the spirit of liberation, reminding players that each battle fought is a step towards reclaiming the world from the oppressive forces, much like our fight against deforestation.

I must say, this game has stolen my heart, and I find myself, much like the Lorax, spending countless hours immersed in its beauty and excitement. It's a virtual journey that resonates with the call to protect our environment, making it not just a game, but a meaningful experience that will leave a lasting impact on players.

So, heed my words and dive into the world of Helldivers 2, my friends. Let the spirit of cooperation and environmental consciousness guide your way. I am the fu**ing Lorax and I speak for the trees and the trees love democracy.

First you couldnt join because the servers were capped at a low number and had about double or triple the amount trying to play. Now you cant join your friends game and they cant join yours. They made so much money and cant fix simple stuff like this. HD2 reviews are up again but im sure theyll take a dive soon. Its a fun game. When you can actually play it is.

This game is fun when it works. It is very apparent that the Devs expected this game to flop immediately upon release because they made the servers for 20 players at one time globally. When the game finally worked after days on end being stuck at a failed to launch menu the Devs added an addition 5 seats in the server and I finally played the tutorial. After the tutorial was over I was excited to hell dive with some friends, Well guess what? You have to spend an hour and a half trying to trouble shoot getting together with your friends. When you finally manage to you have about 5 minutes of game time before it crashes. I understand some people have the game working just fine and good for them. I am just tired of waiting for the Devs to fix their busted at launch game. This is a game that is extremely fun with friends that you can't play with friends.

Edit: It is much more playable after a couple weeks of updates and back end updates.

Incredible game, shines the most with a group. 

A unique method for calling in tactical support and making players both feel invincible and hopelessly outmached, seamlessly transitioning between these feelings throughout the course of a match.

Should be the standard for what live service should mean; something that's used to support gameplay and make the players actions involved in the game. 

Awe-inspiring conflict, wartime horror, and farcical comedy all come together in a game that displays its inspirations with pride and will hopefully change how we look at the way online games and third person shooters going forward.

As of 2/19/2024, there are server issues due to an overwhelming number of concurrent players, leading to long wait times to launch the game. Devs have been transparent and incredibly swift with expanding capacity and improving stability since launch, and have earned my confidence that this will not be a permanent issue.

As of 2/24/24 the sever issues mentioned above have been largely fixed; player capacity has been increased and measures have been introduced to keep up stability during times of high player count. Played during peak hours on Friday-Saturday and things were smooth.

Such a fun game to just have a boys night and die for your government.

"Helldivers 2" builds upon the strong foundation laid by its predecessor, offering an exhilarating and challenging cooperative twin-stick shooter experience that fans of the genre will find hard to put down. The game, set in a satirical and dystopian future, tasks players with working together to combat a variety of alien threats, emphasizing teamwork, strategy, and precision.

The visuals in "Helldivers 2" have received a significant upgrade, with more detailed environments and character models, making the chaotic battles even more immersive. The game's sound design is equally impressive, with an engaging soundtrack and sound effects that perfectly complement the on-screen action.

One of the game's strengths is its depth of gameplay. With a wide array of weapons, perks, and stratagems, players can tailor their characters to suit their playstyle or the needs of their team. This level of customization adds to the game's replayability, encouraging players to experiment with different combinations to overcome the increasingly challenging missions.

The cooperative play is where "Helldivers 2" truly shines. The game requires players to communicate and coordinate their actions carefully, as friendly fire is always on, adding an extra layer of tension and strategy to the missions. This can lead to exhilarating moments of triumph and, occasionally, hilarious mishaps when things don't go as planned.

However, the game is not without its faults. The difficulty can sometimes feel unforgiving, especially for newer players or those venturing into missions solo. While this steep learning curve can be rewarding, it might deter less experienced players. Additionally, the matchmaking system could be improved to facilitate smoother connections and a more streamlined experience when joining games in progress.

In conclusion, "Helldivers 2" is a worthy successor that takes everything great about the original and amplifies it. Its challenging gameplay, deep customization options, and focus on cooperative play make it a must-play for fans of the series and newcomers alike. While it may not be for everyone due to its high difficulty level, those who embrace its challenges will find a deeply rewarding and fun experience.

TLDR: Game is good but has major flaws.
This game is some of the most fun I've had with a coop shooter in a long time however to act like their isn't major flaws is absurd. For starters this game is full of bugs, the game has only been out for two weeks however a large amount of bugs reported have yet to be patched and while most of these are harmless and sometimes funny, a few of them create major flaws with the game play and can be incredibly frustrating like having an airstrike get called on top of you because the game decided to spawn that instead of the supply pack you called for. I have also managed to fall under the map twice however those could be excused as one off things. Another thing that should be noted is that the progression in the game can be slow as outside of strategems, unlocking everything else can be grindy and slow due to samples being somewhat hard to keep and maintain with how often you die in this game and only obtaining low amounts of medals for completing missions making unlocking weapons, boosts, and armour slow to unlock. Weapon balancing is also non-existent as running a grenade launcher with supply pack outclasses every other primary and support having next to no downsides, having one weapon being op would be fine if the other weapons were still viable right? Well good like finding a useful one as all primary weapons do too little damage and don't have enough ammo for multiple enemies and all support weapons are incredibly gimmicky, don't have enough ammo or are just flat out useless. Performance is fine however the game could definitely be running better and this is clearly a result of a lackluster pc port, for context my pc is more powerful than a ps5 and is averaging lower fps than it. I can excuse the game for it as their usually is lots of explosions and enemies rendered on screen at once however this is something you should consider. These are all issues I'm sure will get fixed in later updates however that doesn't excuse the condition of the game now.

This is a game that does not take advantage of you.  There is no BS, no paying for power, no paying for shortcuts to max level, no RNG, no dumb crap about unlocking characters in battlepasses.  You don't have to worry about FOMO, you don't have to worry about lootboxes of any kind.  Everything that modern games do, with MTX shops, this game doesn't do.  You don't have to spend a dime beyond paying for the game itself.  You have a chance to get all currencies in missions, so long as you're even a little bit observant, you can get the premium currency totally without spending a dime.  

As for gameplay, it is superb.  Difficulty is balanced around having four people in your team. That means, you're going to have a very, very rough time if you want to play solo, even though you could theoretically do so if you're that good, it is unlikely for the average player, so while there are some speed bumps towards finding matches from time to time, that's only due to it being a brand new game with new game hiccups.  Overall, its a relieving form of challenging, its not artificially difficult, no more than any other four player horde shooter ever has been, at least.

There's a very solid game loop.  Some objectives and missions are much easier than others, some are more difficult, some can be soloed, most require at least some thought to approach if you're on your own, or backup to ensure that you're not caught exposed on your own.  Enemy variety is very respectable, every enemy has their own unique set of pros and cons, and there's plenty of ways to deal with them with the available tools.  That's key to making a fun game that has a long life span in my humble view, its specifically oriented towards letting people find their own approaches and gameplay preference and style.  If you like to hold down the fort with heavy BRRT guns, there's an option for that.  If you prefer being the sneaky stealthy playstyle, that's very well supported.  

As far as I'm concerned, this game has the potential to go hard over a long, long time.  The explosion of players alone is evidence that its a beloved, extremely appealing game.  I've sunk 50 hours in at time of this review, and I can easily see myself putting in ten times that over the next few months alone, maybe even more.  I love PVE horde shooters, and this game has a very positive experience and its community is very knowledgeable and welcoming.  That's a recipe for success.

Its well worth the buy.  Take your time learning the mechanics, once you have them learned, you'll do extremely well for yourself.  Have fun, and lets spread some Democracy!

UDATE: 02/24/2024: 

The devs/publishers/game company defiantly resolved most of the server issues.

PC POINT OF VIEW (non controller, non PS5  perspective).

INSTALLING:  
I had no issues.  I didn't have to change or modify any settings or files or install additional stuff.  I went slow and didn't try rushing through the install process like my pants were on fire.  I don't know what all the fuss was for some people, but they were impatient and went through stuff too quickly, like a fat chick at an all-you-can-eat buffet.

INITIAL GAME LOADING NOTES:
Almost everything asked and set at the initial game loading can be revered or changed later in the game settings menu.  There is one thing that I'd [skip]... The PlayStation network linked to your Steam account is NOT REQUIRED TO PLAY ON PC!!!  I tried linking my accounts (like a good little monkey).  The setup process to create a PlayStation account could have been better just for the validation process.  At one point, I became super frustrated and was ready to quit and get a refund (but obviously, I did not).

TUTORIAL NOTES:

* The tutorial ends when you get launched up to your ship.
* Follow directions and use the indicated keyboard keys, such as [tab], for the mini-map hold-toggle (yeah, a hold-toggle is annoying, but I'm unsure if there's a way to change/modify it). 
* You can rebind the keys AFTER; do not be tempted to rebind before boarding your ship.
* There is no jump function; you can vault over objects with the [space-bar] or just run/sprint [shift] at them. 
* Make sure to stand in the right spot; for example, when planting the flag on the platform, do not walk off the platform's edge when saluting the flag.
* You must use the number keys to switch weapons instead of the mouse wheel - Is there a way to change/modify it? 

SOLO ONLINE VS COOP: 

The game is really designed for cooperative play.  It's possible to solo play in the sense of "matchmaking" with a few random players that you do not know.  I have not come across unfriendly of selfish players (hoping it stays that way too).

I'll review the game more as I play through.
Fantastic game, cinematic battles, great team dynamics, and the opportunity to fight for the glory of Super Earth!

Game gives you non stop "wtf did I just do" moments with a lot of "I rule moments" and some wild "I gotta do that again" moments.

If you were waiting for the game to be playable because of the servers, I have had little to no problems after the most recent patch. If you are waiting for this game to go on sale, it needs to be at the top of your wishlist. If you think that the $40 price tag IS the sale-nope. This game costs less than almost every AAA game that has come out this year, and (IMO) it blows them all out of the water.

The gameplay loop is incredibly tight. You shoot bugs/bots-either they explode into tiny pieces, or you do-then you run to the next objective and do it all over again. You COULD optimise the shit our of every part of the game, but unlike other games, that is the WORST way to play Helldivers 2. This game puts fun above all else, and is the only live service model that I've seen today that is not: 1. Incredibly predatory with Micro transactions 2. Drip feeding content to try and string you along 3. Lock everything behind a gigantic grind so that you'll be maxing out your playtime just to get a passable loadout.

Arrowhead launched the OG Helldivers in 2013. I will still boot up that game and have a blast. I know that with how things are going, Helldivers 2 is going to be one of my most played games for years.

Do you like Freedom? Liberty? Super Democracy! Then this game is for you! You become a orbital drop shock trooper known as a hell diver! Massive explosion, huge hordes of bugs(who escaped from our farms where we harvest them for oil) and anti freedom bots. 

The game is very simple.
Drop in, do objectives (S&D/Capture/Evac/Extract)
Collect samples well doing said mission (Samples are shared so it doesnt matter who extracts them!)
Also earn Eagles and Super Credits(cash shop currency) by hitting up Point of Interests in the game, you very well can buy the premium pass with out buying the 60/70$ version of the game.

Can you run Solo? YES! though once you hit tier 7-9 it will dif become a lot harder to do it soloable but dif not impossible (well unless its the event Defend missions where you gotta evac peeps)

Weapon wise! theres 2 type of weapons Primary and Support.

Primary weapons you unlock with eagles in the semi battlepass. Eagles are earned from completing missions and finding them in missions so dif hit up those point of interest! 

Support weapons are ones you call in and generally have small to very long cooldowns. from machine guns all the to a railgun/Javelin missiles (its called SPEAR)

Hope this helps anyone whos interested in the game :D

I had to wait until the servers/capacity was playable to finally recommend Helldivers 2. I've had no issues the last few days, so I can finally confidently recommend this fantastic game. It's really fun, it's good value, it's fairly well polished, it's just a really good time. If you are stuck playing with randoms, it's decent, but if you can wrangle up a couple friends you'll have a fantastic time spread democracy and spilling oil. 

I've been able to buy the 'premium' battlepass with freely earned premium currency fairly easily. Battlepasses and MTX are major red flags to me, but *at the moment*, everything seems priced fairly for a mid-budget game.

It's basically Starship Troopers, but better.  Just kidding you Starship fans.  It's a solid co-op game.  It's a big buggy post release with server issues and the occasional crash, but they are actively working on them and seem to be pretty responsive to the community.  I'm only a few hours in, but I got to admit, I'm having fun.

UPDATE (2/24/24) - They seem to have solved the main issues by combining server optimization with enforced AFK logoff. Surprise surprise, it dropped concurrent player counts by 25% the first day lol. There are still some balance issues, and they need to add player advancement options for levels 21-50 beyond just titles, but it's nothing game breaking any more.

------------------------------

TL;DR - If you buy it now you'll just be paying to wait in a queue and then get constant disconnects. Wait for them to fix it first, rather than paying for the privilege of stress testing.

The game is amazingly fun, when you can play it. That last is key, because despite selling over a million copies their system can't handle even 400k concurrent players. The issue has been going on for over a week, and results in a multitude of game play issues. For example, so far my gaming group and I have frequently experienced:

- Disconnects resulting in loss of all progress in a mission because rewards aren't given until completion. This has happened during the reporting after a mission. And on top of it, you get stuck back in the logon queue.
- Character freezing for 30 seconds on looting anything, only able to turn the camera
- No loot or xp after a successfully completed mission
- Inability to unlock any upgrades or purchase anything with medals - When holding down the Confirm button it finishes, then goes grey and nothing happens
- Random deaths from cause "unknown"
- Escort missions on easy difficulty that drop 100+ robots on you in under 2 minutes.
- "Quick play" that doesn't actually work. The best people can recommend on reddit is "spam it and hope for the best", whatever the hell that means.
- The game completely locking up when the host leaves, causing you to have to ALT-F4 it.
- The logon server not actually queuing people, and instead letting them in randomly. For example, I've been able to connect multiple times while someone sitting a room away was waiting for over an hour.

Long story short? Unless you're unemployed or are otherwise able to play outside of peak hours (i.e. earlier than 5 PM EST), don't waste your money until they fix their busted game.

Editing my original review to change it to Recommend.

When this game first launched it was nearly impossible to consistently get into any missions. Disconnects, crashes, log in failures, and servers being overloaded were preventing anyone and everyone from playing. It wasn't ideal, especially on the weekends. However, after weeks of nonstop work, Arrowhead Game Studios has finally got this game in a stable and working state. It truly is incredible how much effort they have put in since launch to get this game going. On paper, praising a developer for getting their game actually working post-launch is kind of sad, but I cannot stress how insane of a launch this game had compared to their previous game. 

When the original Helldivers launched on Steam after being a Playstation exclusive it had an all-time peak player count of 6,691 players. As of writing, in the past 24 hours Helldivers 2 has had an all-time peak player count of 458,709 players. That is insane. That's a 6755% increase between the two games. To say Helldivers 2 is a success would be an understatement. This might be the Game of the Year and I say that without a hint of sarcasm. However, with that success came the server issues where no one could play. Nobody, not even Arrowhead Game Studios saw this coming. So the fact they got this game's server capacity upgraded and fixed a deluge of connectivity issues in such a short time is incredible. I had set my original review to Not Recommend because at one point I couldn't even play the game during the weekend. That isn't fun and I wouldn't recommend that experience (or lack thereof) to anyone, but I knew they would turn things around and I am very glad to they did.

As for the game itself, it's incredible. Truly a unique and exciting experience. The gun play is fantastic. The enemies are brutal and varied. The SFX for explosions and fire elevate the combat to cinematic events. The community is wonderful, especially when it comes to in-game events. There are micro-transactions, but this might be the first game I've seen in a long long time where micro-transactions are actually micro. A set of armor costs like $2 and you can earn the in-game currency by playing missions and finding it on the maps. It takes a while, but you can also accrue enough to even buy the premium gear. There is a bit of toxicity and griefing in the game due to there being friendly fire. Game hosts can also kick anyone at anytime for any reason and I have myself been booted from games while waiting for extraction at the end, so I didn't get any rewards for the mission. I'm sure the developer will work on alleviating some of these issues, but for now all you can do is just block players and move on.

In conclusion, this game is another win for the right side of history. For Super Earth!

I love this game, I really do, but there are quite a few issues that are really turning me off from playing it.

1. I'll do a 40 minute mission in a random lobby, then the host will kill me and kick me 10 seconds before the extraction ship arrives.  I'll load back into my own ship with ZERO rewards having wasted 40 minutes of my time for some jackoff to get a chuckle.

2. Level 6 cadets making really high difficulty lobbies and only loading out with machine guns.  I have to sort through so many of these before I find a group that has anti armor stuff.  When I do find a game that's not all cadets, the situation in 1 happens half the time.

These wouldn't be as big of an issue if you could just block people, but the feature to see who you've recently played with doesn't work half the time and when it does, you have to memorize the names of the people in the game because it won't tell you which "Recently played" people were in your last game.

"Just play with friends!"  I shouldn't have to exclusively play with friends or alone to have a good experience with a game that's been designed and balanced around group play.

The game is fun. The game is a battle. If it's not fun, why bother? If it's not a battle, where's the fun? It's a test that you pass or a quest that you fail. A race against time. Fun and battle always lock together. But the game is also something else. It's a journey; a passport to new worlds, maybe even an odyssey. A look, a feel, an exploration, close your focus and open your mind. Yes, the journey requires the right ticket, and that ticket is an online connection to the damn server that might not let you go in because it's saturated!!

 They've expanded server's capacity, so let's hope they can hold up the influx of players right now. That being said, there's a couple things I don't like, comparing it with the previous game:

[list]
[*] They nerfed the Jump Pack, now it has a cooldown and doesn't require fuel. This means you have to wait about 15 seconds per jump, while you could jump as soon as you wanted as long as you had fuel on the previous game; also, with the changes on gameplay, the Jump Pack lacks the same maneuverability it used to have (like jumping a charger, which can be done, but it's not as reliable as before).

[*] The armament selection is disappointing, and we're not getting crazy stuff like the Justice that punched through enemies, the Suppressor which was a rifle with actual explosive bullets (as in, it does AoE damage and you can kill yourself with it, "Explosives" in this game only deall more damage to squishy parts, and you can shoot at the floor on your feet and get no damage, cause there's no proper explosion), or the ever hated Trident (Laser Shotgun). I hope we get something good as things goes on, cause right now most of the guns are lacking power, and the Breaker is ruling supreme. The Scorcher is in the game too, but I have yet to see if it does AoE damage as in the previous game, and also burns anyone caught in the area.

[*] Armors now have an effect on you instead of being just cosmetics, so you better pay attention to what you're wearing, or you might start running slow cause your armor is heavy, or taking more damage cause it's light (but you move faster), amongst other effects they might have.

[*] We are lacking A LOT of firepower, and the counterplay for tanks was shifted from "Blow it with an orbital strike, a nuke or anything strong enough" to "Blow it's armor with the Railgun, and pray you do enough damage on the squishy parts to kill it". You can still blow them with a stratagem, but there's like 2 that will do so efficiently, and they have heavy cooldowns (about 2 minutes, which means you're on your own against the rest of the tanks that might spawn, or survived your strike).

[*] Progression is locked into a Battle Pass, and while it is not as awful as every other garbage pass, it might be annoying for many players because that's how you unlock weapons. For instance, to get the Scythe (laser rifle) you need about 160 medals spent, and then like 30 for the gun itself (you get about 10 per full mission, so it's not as bad as it might seem).

[*] Guns are not upgradeable, your only choice is to grind the battle pass and try an alternative version of it (Say... Liberator Penetrator, an alternative version of the first gun you get in game), and as I said before, a lot of these guns feel underwhelming (hopefully they will buff them, instead of being lazy and nerfing the breaker).

[*] Samples are split on 3 ranks, which means you can't just take it easy and grind away on low levels (as in the first game) to arm yourself for higher challenges.
[/list]

 Keep in mind that while the game has a battle pass and a "premium store" that only sells skins, you can get the premium currency by just playing and exploring around (I think you get like 10 super credits per cache found on a mission).

 Overall, the game has a lot of potential, and I hope it doesn't disappoint. I also hope they give me my Shredder back and unnerf the jump pack, I WANT MY NUKE GOD DAMMIT!!.

Allow me to set the scene for you.

You feel the cooling waters of the creek dance over your Hell Diver armor. You take 2.4 seconds, as allowed by Super Earth high command, to glance up into the night sky. You see the violet moon with stars littering the sky. Your short peace is interrupted by a binary language echoing in the nearby trees. You feel a cold sweat run down your nose are you try to pinpoint where the noise is coming from. It surrounds you like deaths cold embrace. Then you see it, an Automaton assembly plant with a patrol coming out of it. 

You slowly rise from the creek that gave you but a moment of peace and wade through the water towards the patrol. Your ears begin to ring as your finger holds down the trigger of your SG-225 Breaker. You can't help but to grin as oil and bolts dance into the night sky and your bullets shred through alloy of an unknown origin.

Then you hear it, "Requesting air support". You glance towards your left and see a fellow Hell Diver, a brother in arms, throwing down 500kg of pure liber-tea onto the assembly plant. You stand together, both saluting the most awesome display of firepower either of you have ever seen. Oil, metal and fire sting your Hell Diver suit like a tsunami from Hell. You feel none of that though, for the only thing you feel is sweet democracy coursing through your veins. 

Glorious Victory.

You return to orbit, suits covered in oil and scorch marks. A good start to the day. The ships TV turns on, you eagerly await a new tip from General Brasch himself... but wait, something is different this time. "Hell Divers, we have a rogue Hell Diver known as GantzTheDemon, high command has issued a bounty of 10,000 super credits for any Hell Diver willing to take him out. For liberty, democracy and for SUPER EARTH!" 

It seems as though oil will not be the only thing spilled today.

As a Helldivers 1 veteran, I was worried that Helldivers 2 would stray away from what made it so great in the first place.  It was never really more than a cult classic at best, but I think it had a good niche that it hit.  Top-down coop shooters like Helldivers and Magicka were what I knew Arrowhead for, anyway.  My friends reassured me that Helldivers 2 would be impossible to mess up.  If they treated it like Risk of Rain 2 and ported the formula directly over to 3D, it would be an amazing game.

After 50 hours and counting in the game, I am glad to say that Helldivers 2 is an amazing return to form for Helldivers and the gaming industry as a whole.  It truly is Helldivers 1 in 3D, with an amazing setting, fun tools, and two unique enemy factions that really package two games into one.  Even as a live service game, the monetization and content are incredibly fair.  All content can be unlocked forever in the future, with a few exceptions (e.g. the preorder bonus), with the premium currency being reasonably collectable in game.  The currencies that are the most important cannot even be bought.  It really puts AAA companies to shame.

The company, developers, and CEO have been incredibly transparent during the process, and I commend them for iterating so quickly on the game.  It was successful beyond their wildest dreams, and I am glad that it was!  There are still some minor stability issues, but they are much better than at launch, and I do not struggle to have an enjoyable experience in the game.    This is the biggest game I can think of that is so respectful of the player, that makes the player want to play the game, and for only 40 dollars.  With releases like Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League and Skull and Bones, Helldivers 2 is the game the people needed.

Pros:
[list]
    [*][b]Totally worth the price.[/b]
    [*]For the first 20 hours you are having so much fun.
    [*]Best current co-op game I know about.
    [*]Being clueless about enemy weaknesses makes for a fun adventure. You can learn these by yourself slowly with trial and error to increase the fun times.
[/list]

Some issues:
[list]
    [*]No melee weapons. Where's my chainsaw and laser sword?
    [*]The fun starts to fade after ~30 hours, especially as a solo.
    [*]Server issues made some of my friends lose interest. No friends, less fun to be had.
    [*]Gets maybe a bit too repetitive after a few weeks once you know all the enemies.
    [*]To be able to play higher difficulties you must play 3 missions that can take 40 mins each. Getting this done with the crashes and server issues turned out surprisingly time consuming with crashes/server issues ruining the progress before you get all the three missions done.
    [*]Automaton hostage missions are some of the worst missions in game at higher difficulties due to the base layouts. Both layouts have their own issues.
    [*]Character build options are meaningless outside stratagems and weapons.
    [*]Armor does not even work yet properly, which is weird. You just gimp yourself by selecting anything but the scout option with more speed and stamina.
    [*]The gameplay on higher difficulties rarely supports any other than "kite kite kite" style of gameplay. The lack of quiet moments is an issue when the mission can last for 40 mins.
    [*]Stratagem scrambling gets old real fast.
    [*]Team work weapons just suck compared to Railgun since it allows you to kite and shoot. Team mate reloading your weapon means you have two immobile helldivers.
    [*]Cosmetic options/rewards are a bit dull to my liking.
    [*]You'll only turn out to use 1 out of 10 the wide stratagem options, which is a shame.
    [*]Higher difficulties are less fun in how they actually play out, but you feel like gimping yourself on rewards when playing on lower difficulties. You can't really go out styling in difficulty 9 which makes it less fun and more of a grind.
[/list]

Even with a big list of issues, I can easily recommend the game due to the initial happy fun times. If you don't like crashes and server issues, wait a few months. The fun will only vanish by playing too much yourself.

Helldivers 2 is a fantastic co-op experience, with exciting moment to moment gameplay, guns that feel great and sound even greater, a wide array of mission types and a hilarious ultra-patriotic aesthetic reminiscent of Starship Troopers. 

The Live Service elements are implemented in a really clever way, with updates and new maps coming in the form of an ever changing warfront and while there are technically microtransactions in that players can choose to purchase premium currency for additional cosmetics, that's only necessary if you're impatient - absolutely everything, premium currency included, can be EARNED through regular play, and at none too slow a pace either. After one session in the game, I'd racked up enough 'premium' currency to buy quite a few of the cash shop items. Players can also earn a fairly substantial series of gameplay unlocks, including new weapons, new combat stratagems (powerful abilities your Helldiver can request in battle like Orbital Strikes) and new gear with a range of perks that help fine tune your character to your preferred playstyle.

It is worth mentioning that the game has a few minor bugs that can cause getting stuck or falling through the map, but these are infrequent and won't spoil overall enjoyment. Also worth a mention is that while quickplay allows for matching with randoms, even middling and up difficulties are pretty punishing and would probably be best enjoyed with friends.

Those are minor nitpicks however - Helldivers 2 is well worth the price and I'm really keen to see what gets added in future updates!

EDIT 24FEB2024: This week saw massive improvements to how they handle logins: there is now a 15 minute AFK timeout which, after it was implemented on 22FEB, has made it so that I have not had an "Server full" messages since.  I will be leaving the old review as testament to how truly hellish logging in was after the game's login count surged.

As for the gameplay, its solid.  There is a desperate need for a balance pass on all the weapons though, as the Breaker is basically the end-all-be-all right now and no other weapon really has even close to its capability to do what a firearm should: kill bugs!.  As for Support weapons, I'd say those need a balance pass too as the Railgun is also an end-all-be-all weapon that nearly invalidates all prior support weapons in all functions but a few (ie, shooting down dropships).  I'm hoping that after all this login nonsense is full sorted they can take a look at player metrics and make it so that we dont have one super-meta build.
All in all, as someone who played Helldivers 1 for too many hours, its a nice difference but I really cant wait to see the EXO-44 Stomper suit and I hope we get some of the other vehicles as well as a weapons balance pass..

As of 19Feb2024, logging in is the next closest thing to impossible.  If you are lucky to make it past the *INCREDIBLY* long black screen of nothingness and get to see the intro, you are then greeted with "Servers at Capacity. Please try again later."

This is coming off a double xp weekend where the devs admitted to having to cap active players at 450,000 concurrent (total from both steam and PS5).  Many are just AFKing in their ships when not playing since the game doesnt have an inactivity forced logout system. 

The discord has posts saying the devs are aware and working on patches this week to help but the first isnt even available until tomorrow and its not a silver bullet patch, but an incremental start.  Now, I'm now expert in programming, just do assembly stuff and PLC stuff, but given that it has been like this through the last week, I would have figured they'd have been working on a set of fixes since 12Feb and not just started working on them like they said on 17Feb...

If they do actually fix the better part of this inability to login by Wednesday 21Feb, I will delete this review.

10/10 fun and engaging co-op PVE-only game with friendly fire enabled wherein you fight alien bugs and robots. Optional micro-transactions, but which are 100% obtainable by playing the game and collecting in-game resources. A seasonal battlepass model stated to be permanent (no FOMO) and a level up for progression for unlocking additional in-game weapons and perks. Overall story and galactic battle map will progress based on player population wins/losses over time makes for an engaging, community-focused vibe with tangible results for what you do as a player. What's not to love?

Launch had some rough server issues due to overwhelmingly high player counts that nobody could have predicted, but it's fine now. Good old fashioned fun gameplay, great visuals, comedic story and voice lines. I also have 100+ hours on PS5. Bought it here to play with my girlfriend.

The hype for this game is absolutely well deserved. I have found myself enjoying so many different elements about Helldivers 2:
-The game play is appealing from the beginning because you are equipped with plenty of firepower to take care of the bugs on your first few missions. Then as you start to progress and challenge yourself more it evolves into highly intense game play that relies on teamwork to successfully complete objectives. 
-At first I feared that playing this game without friends would be unenjoyable; however, my experience with the random matchmaking and community has been fantastic. The PvE style has seem to prevented a lot of toxicity that can ruin a community. 
-The progression of stratagems and other equipment feels very rewarding as you unlock new weapons/armor/stratagems after every couple of missions. 
-The humor/lore of the game is over the top and a perfect tool for keeping things light in a game that can at times feel overwhelming. 

Aside from the occasional bug and the server issues (now seem to be fixed) this game is a truly amazing experience that I am glad I gave a try. 9/10

A brilliant cooperative game that finally sorted out the servers for the most part. Right now HellDivers 2 is a 7/10 for me. There are still crashes, some server issues, armor that doesn't work as intended and not to mention the weapon balance that is in desperate need of QOL updates. Fighting against the bugs is fun but against the automatons it can be a chore. The balancing of some of the automaton units and the fact that there are only 2-3 viable default weapons in the game make fighting them a frustrating slog. Don't even get me started on the civilian extract blitz missions. Overall HellDivers 2 is a ton of fun, but as much as there is to love there is also a lot to loathe. A great foundation for what I'm sure will go down as one of the best coop games of all time a year or two from now.

At the moment, it's raw, but playable. The game mechanics are quite primitive, there's no technique at all, the costumes are monotonous and essentially don't offer much. In short, the field is untilled; it's not like Battlefront.

Now, in order:

BUGS

Connection bug in co-op when you spawn.
Mobs stand still when they spawn until you hit them.
Co-op doesn't always work.
SUGGESTIONS

Customization.
More explosions and destruction.
Boat customization.
Vehicles for interaction (mechs, tanks, etc.).
Traps for mobs.
Diversify mobs (like Terminators) because they are all the same.
Where are the caves?!
Where are the megabosses?
Bunkers that need defending, fortresses.
Where are the swords?
Where epic music for fight ?!
Likes and suggestions.

I'm still a bit torn on this game.  I like the settings, the characters, and music but I don't care for some of the dynamics of the game itself.  I don't like having to send for weapons and ammo or reinforcements.  I really don't care for having to do the codes to call down items.  And the limited ammo and abundant targets means players are often running around with no ammo trying to avoid being killed.  And having to stop and reload just starts to piss me off.

What I would like to see is the battlefield pre-seeded with ammo and weapons.  Maybe that would take away from the game and make it like every other shooter, but it would be better than having four players wandering around the map with their d*ck in their hand waiting for resupply to cool down.  And having one player gallivanting around and giving his all while waiting for reinforcements to cool-down is just as bad.

I can see the appeal of the game on the other points, but this just rubs me wrong.

Could barley play this game and i had it for 2 weeks haha. First server issues, missions not giving xp or rewards LOL (They gave 50% xp bonus when people cant even log in or complete missions POGGERS), disconnects from server consistently in game, now every time i load up its just a black screen i reinstalled twice nice game. 2-3 patches saying they "fixed" servers blah blah. doubt they even did anything but write out the note and send it for the normies to get the bad press away. There is no BALANCE in game. All the armors give the exact amount of hitpoints weather its light or heavy so you might as well run light with the best passive ability you have. all the weapons feel god awful/ waste of money compared to to the BREAKER SHOTGUN which as a primary does more dmg then a SUPPORT/HEAVY weapon. There is loads of stratagems to choose from but players are only gonna bring in 3-4 same ones every game (Railgun, shield gen backpack, 500kg, plus 1). The jetpack is so garbage you can use it twice during a 10min mission and it doesnt even take you that far LMAO.  dont even need a tier list. Give it a month when the hype dies down and there is only under 100k-50k playerbase. this game is extremely grindy so most players will likely drop it under 200hrs. 60-100 common samples just for tier 1 upgrades LOL. There is a paid battlepass where you can only get weapons and armor from giving out more money oh and it probably takes 1k medals or more to even get half the items on the pass on there and half of them are useless nerf guns so good luck. hopefully in a month this is more fleshed out game with balanced weapons that all have a use an dont feel useless and actually armor values that are implemented in the game.

TLDR: GOOD GAME, BAD SERVERS, UNBALANCED.

Edit: The developers never gave up and day by day they patched the servers making them working. Great visuals, amazing immersive game play. Armor and weapons still unbalanced when writing this. Highly recommend buying this game especially since is $40 and not $70.

This game's incredibly fun, I've honestly had good experiences with both rando's and friends. Shooting is satisfying and there's a nice number of weapons, the soundtrack is fantastic, and enemies don't feel unfair to fight against. 
My only critiques are probably more personal nitpicks that I'd like to see changed. For starters the music needs more tracks as it's just a bit too repetitive. I won't deny that its a real banger of a soundtrack, and the composer should be fucking proud, but hearing the same music over and over, yeah, needs a bit more variety there.  
Speaking of variety, I feel there aren't enough enemy types at the moment. So far its only the bug aliens, and the mechanoids. Would be nice to have a couple more factions or races to fight against. I know in the first game there were only 3, and given this sequel has a much higher budget I'd love to see a much bigger number this time around. 
It had an extremely rocky start though, with servers being "at capacity", and people unable to play until just recently because of it (and by recently I mean like, until 2 days ago). So the negative reviews are more than deserved on that front.  
Overall though, a really fun game that I'd say is now worth $40. I've had tons of fun with it so far. Highly recommended

Now that the server issues are mostly resolved, I recommend this game.  It still isn't perfect -- crashes and glitches can still ruin an otherwise good run -- but the game gets the balance of challenge, humour, pacing, and satisfying gun play just right.  Pick it up and try to convince 3 other friends to do the same.  It's fun solo, but better with friends.

The game is simply amazing the most fun I have had in a multi-player games in years. PVE with 4 man squads bringing democracy to insectiods and robots regardless of if they want it or not.

There is a solid variety of missions and as you increase the difficult settings you will get more missions and multi-mission groups with increased medals(used to unlock new gear) with each mission in a series that you complete. This can be anything from destroying enemy bases, to turning on supply pumps, launching an ICBM, taking out enemy elites etc... Missions can also have modifiers from simply to day vs. night, heavy fog, and jamming beacons. 

There is a lot of customization from your armor, to your weapons, and stratagems. Stratagems are orbital support from your ship. Calling down advanced weapons, or calling in air strikes or orbital bombardment, or reinforcements if a squad-mate dies. 

Where this game shines is in the combat and the pressure it puts on you and the squad. Enemies can call in reinforcements. Running into a random patrol or trying to take out an enemy base an result in multiple waves of reinforcements coming in from different directions including various tiers of elites that cannot be taken out with standard weapons easily. Frantically calling in air support or orbital strikes while running/dodging away from enemy attacks is amazing chaos.

With being able call in reinforcements to bring dead squad mates back into the fight death you are never out of the action for to long. 

I also want to mention on high/ultra settings the game looks great. Planets are distinctly different, lots of terrain variety. The effects of air strikes, and explosions and enemy attacks make it look like a cinematic war film at times.

This is one of the best team-based arcade shooters I’ve played in years. It takes me back to the 360/ps3 era. Ya know, when gaming was good. First, let me address the 2 major elephants in the room.

The servers seem to have been fixed. The devs released 2 patches over the past few days. One of them increased the capacity, and the other added an afk kick system. (Which is hilarious, because I think a good portion of the capacity issue was caused by people leaving the game running for hours to “reserve their slot” after they finally did connect) But since these patches, I haven't experienced a single issue connecting to the game. And I've been playing during peak time.
The other issue people seem to have with the game is the “nprotect” anti-cheat. Admittedly, I don’t know much about the software, So I’ll keep this brief. The software has no noticeable impact on game performance or the operation of your PC. Feel however you may about the actual effectiveness of anti-cheat, but the borderline conspiracy theories about “kernel level hijacking,” “data stealing”, and whatnot seem overly paranoid and unfounded. It’s just anti-cheat, chill. Chances are you play several other games with similar software running in the background. It’s kinda lame, but it is what it is.

Onto the game itself, it’s awesome. The progression is steady. Everything feels viable (at least in certain scenarios) from weapons, artillery, gadgets, and more. And it’s easy to find a playstyle that suits you and synergizes with your team. Progression is also steady; there’s always something exciting that you’re “Just a few more credits/medals” away from unlocking.

The game is surprisingly immersive. I love the way most of the UI comes from your ship, rather than a boring list of menus. And the ODST drop sequence when starting a mission never stops feeling bad@ss. It also creates a really funny parody of…a certain country’s military and the community larping is awesome.

Gameplay is intense, and the action is non-stop. Most things (like interacting with objectives, calling in support, and reviving teammates) require this Konami code-style sequence of directional inputs, which should be super annoying; but there’s nothing like being pinned down and surrounded by gunshots and explosions while you keep frantically f*cking up the command to call in an airstrike. There are also several difficulty options ranging from too easy, to manageable, to an unrelenting onslaught of totally unfair bullsh*t. The great thing about it is that you can play on whatever difficulty you’re comfortable with, without feeling like you’re missing out or being punished for it.

And finally, the devs actually nail monetization. It technically has a “battle pass” system, but it does 2 things really well. It doesn’t expire, meaning you’re not pressured into playing the game like a full-time job just to unlock everything. And the “premium battle pass” can actually be unlocked without having to spend a dime, since the free version will give you enough currency to purchase it by the end. There’s still a rotating “Fortnite store” of cosmetics, which I’m not a fan of, but the $1 to $2 asking price for most items is leagues better than paying $15 to $20 for color swatches in most other AAA titles.

Well, that’s about it. Take the complaints about servers and nprotect with a massive grain of salt. If you’ve seen gameplay and you think you’ll like it, you probably will. So as the subreddit would say, join the fight for freedom, and liberty, and honor, and democracy, and stuff. (Also, I really want those 12k credits. So if you could help us kill the robots, that would be great!)

I'm going to keep playing it, but only because I paid $40 for it. The gameplay is fine, a bit boring and repetitive though. You enter the game and BAM, you have to load maps and play. There is no back story, no campaign mode, nothing really.  If that's the kind of game for you, you'll love it. But I prefer games to have some meaning or reason. It's fun-ish, but not something I could see playing more than a game or two here or there. I know it's only been out a few weeks now, but I've had multiple lockups and game crashes that I don't get in any of the other games I play. My long-term concern for the game is that as the hype dies down, less people will play, and it'll be difficult to find groups.  I guess the one thing I would say negatively about the gameplay is that I feel like I run out of ammo way too frequently, so the game feels more like just trying to train mobs away so I can complete the objectives, instead of full on killing. I'm not saying unlimited ammo, but double it, at least.

While the game is good in many aspects, there are definitely some weird design decisions, and after server issues being resolved to a level you can at least login balance and design issues still stand.
Good:
- visual and sound design; game looks amazing, style is rather consistent, music and sound effects are great.
- gunplay; guns feel amazing, sound amazing and produce nice feedback, gory and meaty. Also some of the weapons can be operated in pairs, which is a super cool mechanic.
- gameplay loop; it's mindless fun, shooting enemies and then producing epic explosions sending parts of enemies flying feels really great, and there isn't anything this good on the market.
Questionable:
- UI/UX; sometimes you're not given any information regarding values, like you don't know how much damage stratagems deal, ammo reserves of weapons, etc. Also, you can't leave the squad, only quit the game(?). No reconnect feature for 2024 game is also rather weird, especially since sessions are often 20m+, and losing progress feels bad.
- content; while game was just recently released, it's not an early access title, but amount of enemie types is around 20, for both factions summarised, for example, and some of them are just bigger versions. Not a ton of weapons either, and not many possibilities for a deep buildcrafting. Foundation is definitely there, though, so we'll see how it goes.
Bad:
- servers; while I can sympathize with developers, who did not expect this level of success, current (25.02.24) state is kinda bad - often can not connect to friends or just random games, disconnects, overall weird behavior.
- balance; most of the weapons are not worth taking at all, as well as stratagems. This is caused partially by a weird decision to throw more tanky and armored enemies at players on higher difficulties, instead of more balanced composition and bigger numbers, thus requiring a very specific set of weapons be present at all times, or just dedicating a player for enemy distraction, which breaks game flow significantly. And the difference in performance is so huge it's unclear how developers could miss it, unless nobody checked it, and that possibility raises many more questions.
- bugs; there are some perofrmance issues with AMD hardware, crashes, also at least one system doesn't work at all.

We dropped into Melevelon creek there where rumors but we didn't know the horrors we'd meet, after the initial horrors of the battlefield we moved thoroughly and swiftly taking out the airbases of the damned bots, I watched those i'd spent months with throughout boot camp fall, but we had eventually taken out the air support in the region.

They left me dammit, We were at the extract but the damn thing took 4 minutes... they said it'd take two, and this abomination of steel had emerged from the horizon line. Soon after our gaze was met by a pillar of fire, untold carnage... i watched the fire spread through our once confident line, we had nothing to compete with the colossus. we all spread in different directions but I knew we had to make that ship... We gathered in the nearby forest and made a plan, the ship had 48 seconds left, we ran and I split to the left of my team, held a flare high and looked at the abomination... I promised them they'd get home.

I watched the ship leave certain my story was to be left to a plaque on an obelisk or a museum, but I was wrong, I was left to the horrors of this place, and never knew there was no choice but to overcome them. I looked at the flare in my hands and heard Hellfighters by Sabaton tune into my comms. The flare grew brighter. I ran towards the cliff and leaped towards the colossus straddling it's back. it's whirring blades of tyranny and fires of subjugation flared towards me but I was unmoved. I ripped the console open and shoved the flare into the circuitry of the machine and watched the lights of the horror thrash and obey my democracy. I leaped off the machine and watched the blast that followed signaling to the automatons they were to be fated to the glory of MY DEMOCRACY! as the blades and metal paneling unraveled itself and the metal demon was felled I left my mark, my words of terror to be written into the code of these bots for millennia. "Now, How's that for a cup of liber-tea!" (Cool ass explosion noise that sounds like an explosion but bad ass) I looked up towards the horizon and saluted my fellow Helldivers while (Don't Fear) The Reaper by Blue Oyster Cult played... We sure gave em hell huh...


Soldiers, Comrades, Citizens hear me and join the war... LIBERATE MELEVELON CREEK... STAND WITH ME!

While I stand by my original position of this game having launched in an unacceptably broken state, I can now say that it has been fixed enough for me to give it a review based on my game-play experience, and not on the fact that said game-play was completely inaccessible to me for several days before being fixed.

I played the first Helldivers quite a bit and absolutely loved it, so I was excited when the second one was confirmed. Unfortunately, if what you are expecting is a fully faithful sequel, you will be disappointed. This does NOT, however, mean that the game is bad.

From the time of writing, an entire faction is gone, stratagems and weapons cannot be individually upgraded, there are no vehicles, and the game is no longer top-down, which was enough to make me feel alienated for a while until I got used to the changes.

Teamwork is both more important than the first game, and much harder to achieve in the sequel now that the team is no longer physically forced to stick together like in the first game (due to the top-down gameplay), while also having limited revives.

 From experience in difficulties ranging from 5-9, this has had both positive and negative effects on the individual players, based on their skill level. Experienced players and/or coordinated teams can split up and make missions more efficient, while less experienced or non-communicating teams can and will suffer from a lack of teamwork and being split up, causing them to deplete their reinforcements quickly.

Despite all this, Helldivers 2 was a truly enjoyable experience to me, despite feeling like I was playing an entirely different game, rather than a sequel. If you were holding off on buying it due to launch issues, I'd say you should give it a go now, and see if you like it.

Out of a sea of just overpriced and empty feelings game which lack a desire or incentive to play, Hell-divers 2 provides the best thing what you want to look for in a game.....fun. The premise is simple/repetitive but that is its biggest strength, allowing accessibility to all times of new, old, casual and competitive players. You are also given tools to play and experiment with and develop your own play style/role in a squad, Heavy gunner? Yeah, Precision Shooter? Yeah, Support? Yeah, Demolitions?.... Absolutely. All of this AND in the current gaming market (for the UK) it was only £35 and even this price they have a "battle pass" which DOESN'T FEEL REQUIRED to progress and customise your character, instead just feels like a side thing to purchase if you like the armour sets. 

Now it is true in its current state, it is buggy and the obvious server issues are a problem and has made the initial hype for the game rather frustrating. HOWEVER for the Studio to recognise the problems and being incredibly clear in communicating that they are trying to resolve them by updating the community nearly daily and to release this super addictive and a "back in the old days" type of gaming, which I can only imagine me n my friends reminiscing about in 10 years or so like we do with halo or CoD. All of this AND has a reasonably balanced pricing, this game feels like a diamond a dozen in a toxic money hungry market that wants money first then maybe the game will be fun later on......maybe and Hell-divers 2 proves the opposite. If you make your game fun first then I will happily pay for more and just like this review, will recommend it to everyone

[h1] Preface[/h1]
I just tested the game shortly playing the tutorial,  because I don't want to start it now, still busy with complete some other games upfront.

[h1] Review Bombing[/h1]
From my perspective so far everything was running quite smooth for me (my specs are at the end of this review) at least in tutorial. In normal missions from time to time I had some crashes (which I was able to avoid after changing graphics settings). For me it seems like the early adopters had some issues because of server connections. But what a suprise, this game immedately was 2nd place in most played games because 50.000 people tried to play it. The game dev's reacted as fast as possible and did already bring a patch which should solve major issues + had an open communication on their discord server + x (twitter) about it. I don't get why people complain about the anti cheat, I mean you can read it up front or refund if you don't like, why they have to review bomb because of anti cheat... I don't get it.
From my perspective the gaming community is not very nice to the dev's, don't be so though and give them a chance. If you would have any clue about software development and golives (especially when 50.000 people want play instant after release) maybe the most people would judge in a different way. Also some others complain about the controls are just made for controllers ans with mouse it doesn't feels natuarl, I doesn't agree. I played a lot of shooters in my life, Counterstrike, Battlefield, The finals... and for me it doesn't seems like anything about the controls is anoying... I'm still loving the way you can call stratagems, for me this is a outstanding feature of this game!

[h1] Game Review[/h1]
About the game, of course I completed Helldivers 100%, I expected to have a kind of a third person shooter just a bit converted from the original. Don't get me wrong I can recommend Helldivers to everybody I had a lot of fun and the fact you were able to have couch coop made it perfect for playing it together with my girlfriend and other friends.
https://store.steampowered.com/app/394510/HELLDIVERS_Dive_Harder_Edition/
This game doesn't has local coop but I don't mind, come on it's a third person shooter, I wouldn't play it on one screen even if it would be possible!
But boy oh boy, what I saw it was more than just changing the perspective of Helldivers 2. I was impressed by new beautiful graphics and also the new content, but more to come. For me it seems like the game sometimes crashed in moments of heavy workload for GPU. After playing Tutorial I tried some missions and had some crashes, but after adjusting graphic settings (disable anti aliasing, v-synch and just turn one graphic settings from utlra to high) no crash occured so far...
After some patches, the game is now stable and I don't have any crashes anymore...
I would love to play it with ultra settings, but it's also looks nice and fun is not restricted by playing on high, it would be good to have a Patch for this asap. 

About the story, already during the first intro cut scene I had to smile several times, come on this is awesome. The first tutorial mission you have to earn you cape and prove you worth to be a helldiver - awesome!

About achievements, reading through it, it feels like they didn't do the same mistake and added any grindy achievements. I played 20 hours and have already the most, there is just one achievement missing which can be hard I guess... but let's see after I tried. So 100% is absolute doable even without any teammates.

Overall the first teaser gaming session I had already made me looking forward to start with this game and invest a lot of more time into it. I don't regred buying the super citizen edition because I already have the feeling developers will care about this game  and there is a lot of potential in it!

[list]
[*] [strike]Crashes Alot. (patch fix - 23/2/04)
[/strike]
[*] Black screen after mission happens.
[*] Fails to join lobby (cross play problem with ps5 host) Alot.
[*] Can get kicked from match and ported to your ship.
[*] Can sometimes spawn without a Primary or Secondary weapon.
[*] Can sometimes have your primary or Secondary weapon removed if the host is timed out, the player that receives host will probably have one of their guns removed and have weird errors with using weapons during the match when it happens.
[*] We have to use 3rd party sources to share our [b]"Friend Codes"[/b] online.. hahaha.. it doesnt even let you do it within the game.. its a pretty bad setup for grouping, unless you want a blind pick then "Quick play" is there for you.. you can play with a brand new guy that just unlocked the Mortar.. or the other guy who isnt new but you didnt do what he wanted when he wanted so you get kicked at the extraction point, or use Discord.. because having a lobby we can see within the game would be crazy? who wants efficiency, who wants to be immersed.. or who wants to think that we have spacetravel and all this technology but we gota get on Discord and give out barcode to a different lobby..  the game has alot of short sighted mechanics.
[*] Cant even copy-paste the code the game gives.

[*] The "Recent People" you have played with doesnt let you join on them, you have to add them to friends first.
[*] The "Recent People" you have played with is not in any kind of order, its random organized.
[*] Cross-play is broken sometimes, you cannot join a PC friend if their game host is on PS5.
[*] Lazer body guard will kill your team mates.
[*] There is not much diversity with weapons and armor, the bad ones are bad.
[*] Everytime i play with Americans i need to mute people because of all the racism and abuse.

[*] You cannot paint your gear.
[*] The progression of gear seems weak early game, compared to stuff late game, with only a handful of good choices.
[*] You cannot upgrade low level stuff to be equal to high level stuff, so a clear meta is created, meaning no underdog mechanics or pack instincts for variety.
[*] You cannot change how equipment works, it will always do the same thing it always does without being capable of modifications for cool hybrid equipment.
[*] The "Ready-Up" window where you pick 4 things, is tiny, you have to scroll down all the time.[*] The "Ready-Up" window has no loadout presets.
[*] Its hard to see the Ship-Galactic-War visually progress and change.
[*] No Visual indicator for squad leader.
[*] Cannot request friends from squad, only from recently played.
[*] Some large bugs have no movement sound, they only have sound when they attack.
[*] Tutorial tips are places in poor default spots, like the person who made them doesnt realise they are over the top of great visuals, instead of word wrapped in the top right-hand corner.
[*] You cannot see the Lobby for "Quick play".
[*] Using "Quick play" does not queue you for missions of the difficulty you have set.
[*] There is no indicator that someone requested friends, only online friends, you have to go to the social window and open the friend requests for it to update and show you if you have a request.
[*] Strategem shop doesnt show the keys to call them down, you have to be in a match to see them.
[*] There is no "Rejoin Squad" option, so when the game kicks you, you had better have someone in the group on your friends list, because the "recent players" has no option to join.
[*] If you get kicked from a game, the 30minutes you played is wasted, you get nothing, the game rewards nothing and shafts you with options to get back to the team.
[*] The "friend codes" is a dumb way of grouping.
[*] Mortar Sentry is the Grim Reaper of sentry's. it doesnt even have a contrail to see where to avoid, its just boom dead friendly.

[*] [b]There doesnt seem to be a thing for players to do once they have done all the leveling and achievements, the game dies of shortsightedness.[/b]
[/list]

Game is great but it is still plagued with server and matchmaking issues!

I will update this review once those things have been ironed out.

It's a truly amazing game, I've had a lot fun with it and it's extremely addictive. It looks good, it feels good and it plays good.

However, in its current state, the best recommendation I can give is to wait or to buy at your own risk. The game is unpolished, the matchmaking is broken, there're some game-breaking bugs to top things off as well. It's extremely not okay for the game to crash after you've spent 30 minutes in a session and have 30 seconds left to wait for the extraction.

Moreover, trying to play together with friends can be a nightmare, lobbies are somewhat counter-intuitive and every so often you just can't join your friends for no apparent reason at all. If you're not playing as a full group it can become a major issue as well, because some times the game would fill your group in a matter of seconds, but other times no one would join you at all. Considering massive number of players this game has, one can only assume that it's the problem with the matchmaking itself and not the lack of potential helldivers to jump into your mission. The game also doesn't allow you to reconnect to your last game session after a crash, unless you play with friends.

Not to mention the game has an extremely intrusive anti-cheat system for an entirely PvE-based game and yeah if you're not ready to just swallow this fact up - that's something to be wary of.

To sum things up, I love this game dearly, it's one of the most exciting gaming experiences I've had in a while along with such games as Baldur's Gate 3 or The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom. But it's extremely frustrating to play it at the moment and if you're not ready to stress yourself out - I can only suggest waiting until the game is polished enough. Until then, I have to leave a thumbs down.
Now that the game is playable, it is one of the best games on steam right now. Absolutely worth your money.

Helldivers 2, this game makes me lose sleep! Amazing game and experience with friends!

This game is insane. They brought back old school cheat codes that you input in order to call in airstrikes and artillery etc, it's insanely fun! This whole game is bad ass, tons of enemies on screen, tons of explosions, you can mow down entire jungles with Manged Democracy. Hilarious and fun community, but the game has solo play and is friendly to solo players looking for squads. 
It's not often you buy a game and you just get the whole game. You can purchase a premium battle pass, but if you progress the standard battle pass included with the game, you can acquire enough currency to get the premium one as an "endgame" option. Even though you can purchase premium currency, I never feel like the game is trying to nickle and dime me before I even get to playing, like many other modern games.

THIS is truly gaming at its finest, where everyone all around is just having a good ass time. I sincerely hope that the devs can keep the game on the right track and give it long term life. 

This is my final message from Malevelon Creek. I've learned that hell isn't a fiery pit. It's a humid cesspool, with trees that speak binary. Don't bother looking for me, we've already lost to the Bots. I assume the Xzar sector is next. If you're reading this, I don't ask for aid. I don't ask for reinforcements. Don't even mourn me or my brothers. All I ask for is you to buy Helldivers 2 now and support the war effort.
Spill oil. Tenfold, hundredfold, to the blood we've shed.

This isn't very fun, it's kinda boring, and I played five missions that were all basically the same thing.  I know some people are going to disregard this review (and some of the fanboys are going to get snarky) because I don't have my 100-hour-playtime merit badge before dropping a negative review.  (Or some other arbitrary amount of time: "you need to play for 10 hours"  " you need to play 50 missions" "you need to reach level 15", etc.)  That's just the point though,  instead of keeping this game to play, I went outside and mowed my grass for three hours; mowing grass was a more interesting use of my time.

Negatives:
1. Missions all felt the same.
2. Lot's of load time and filler screens between actual missions (I'm sure it wasn't half the time, but I felt like I was spending more time not killing things and watching some kind of loading screen)
3. No indication of what leveling up was doing i.e. was I progressing leveling up or is this just a skill based arcade shooter (I could look this up, but by this point I knew I was going to bail because the missions were boring).
Positives:
1. cool setting
2. game style was nice with a lot of character
3. gritty feel to the violence and taking damage 

I was really excited to try this out given all the glowing reviews I keep seeing and lots of you-tubers praising it.  I went through the the training tutorial and was ready to mow down some bugs or machines.  Played my first mission and it was just kind of "meh".  Its always a little confusing, a little chaotic the first few minutes of a new game.  
Got into a second mission and it was okay.  I shot things shooting at me, my squad blew up their objectives and we evac'd...after evac, went through some xp and mission goals accomplished screens that took too long. I leveled up but wasn't really sure what that meant;  didn't seem to affect anything (I wasn't  a little tougher to kill, my accuracy or damage didn't go up a fraction of a percent...).
Third mission more of the same, got the feeling I was in loading or menu screens (i.e. the mission selection screens) quite a bit of the time.  Fourth mission, more of the same.  I was level 3 or 4 but the game didn't indicate if that affected my character attributes/abilities or what it was tracking. Fifth mission, killed a few bugs, got killed, was rez'd, killed a few bugs, got killed, was rez'd.  I'm thinking to myself, this isn't very fun, it's kinda boring, and I've played five missions that have all basically been the same thing.  
If you love it, great!  It just wasn't for me.  I'm going to go back and finish mowing my yard....

[h1]The F is going on with this game??...[/h1]
[b]tldr: Server capacity is actually fixed now[/b]

[h3]First post: Can't play,"Servers at capacity"[/h3]
Also if Steam has a hiccup you can't even access the in game terminals let alone play solo missions. It's a great game despite the balance issues it has [i](most items are sidegrades or downgrades to what you start with or just pointless)[/i] but the devs have let it down with all the overhead. Also their discord is closed.

[h3]Update 1: Fumbling[/h3]
So the devs have responded... not by fixing the server capacity issue but by giving out an XP reward to the few players who can actually get into the game. A pretty low blow for those who can't even play after hours of waiting. 

Making this worse is that the game has no AFK timer and people are just staying logged in overnight to avoid getting locked out.

[h3]Update 2: Getting worse[/h3]
Now the game just black screens and doesn't launch.

[h3]Update 3: Fixed?[/h3]
So for the time being they seem to have fixed the game and I can even play it, but we'll see. My expectations have been substantially lowered.

[h3]Update 4: Nope[/h3]
Surprise surprise, they've only partially fixed the problem and it's still a lottery system rather than a queue to get into game.

[h3]Update 5: Seems fixed this time[/h3]
What more can I say, seems the the server limit and connection problems are finally fixed. So now that we can actually get into the game we just need balanced weapons and functioning armor...
